data.title: Former Colts, Chargers quarterback Philip Rivers and wife Tiffany expecting 10th child
data.meta_description: Rivers, 41, is now a high school football coach in Alabama. He played one season with the Colts before retiring.
data.text:
Former Indianapolis Colts quarterback Philip Rivers and his wife Tiffany are expecting their 10th child, according to reports.

The news was first reported by AL.com. It was later reported by ESPN's Adam Schefter. The child, a boy, is expected to arrive in October.

Rivers, 41, is now a high school football coach in Alabama. Before playing his final season in Indianapolis, Rivers played 16 seasons in San Diego and later in Los Angeles, for the Chargers. The eight-time Pro Bowl selection was fifth all-time in passing yards and touchdowns when he retired in 2021.

From 2021: Philip Rivers describes how family helped him through retirement decision

According to AL.com, Rivers' children range in age from 4 to 21. In 2020, Rivers spoke to IndyStar about his family.

“I think really, it was just whatever God’s will was,” Rivers said about his family. “We were just open. Certainly didn’t have a number on it. Still don’t.”

Rivers and his wife have seven girls and two boys currently.
